metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27841 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in openjpeg in versions prior to 2.4.0 in src/lib/openjp2/pi.c. When an attacker is able to provide crafted input to be processed by the openjpeg encoder, this could cause an out-of-bounds read. The greatest impact from this flaw is to application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
No subscription required

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14').
openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6build0.16.04.1').
